intro: Geniostoma novae-caledoniae, commonly known as the New Caledonia flame flower, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family native to the island of New Caledonia. It is a shrub characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often with a distinctive flame-like appearance. The plant has opposite, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
